greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of nonisomorphic binary n X n matrices with k 1's per column under row and column permutations.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..527
StackExchange, How many arrays with crossed cells, order of rows/columns irrelevant, Dec 13 2013
program: permcount(v) = {my(m=1, s=0, k=0, t); for(i=1, #v, t=v[i]; k=if(i>1&&t==v[i-1], k+1, 1); m*=t*k; s+=t); s!/m}
K(q,t,k)={polcoeff(prod(j=1, #q, my(g=gcd(t, q[j])); (1 + x^(q[j]/g) + O(x*x^k))^g), k)}
Blocks(n,m,k)={my(s=0); forpart(q=m, s+=permcount(q)*polcoeff(exp(sum(t=1, n, K(q,t,k)/t*x^t) + O(x*x^n)), n)); s/m!}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, May 23 2018
